TopicTitle: [1.0.5] RSS Planets & Moons expanded v0.12.0 Sedna is finally here!

Articles.Content:
Anyway, about the Earth-intercepting asteroids... I think that it will be not the best idea to do bodies with intercepting orbits until we have them on rails. It looks very unrealistic and, to my mind, it'll be better to do asteroids with stable (resonances are good too) orbits.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-20T23:19:10Z" title="07/20/2015 11:19  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 20, 2015</time> by Einkleinermensch**

> 
> Anyway, about the Earth-intercepting asteroids... I think that it will be not the best idea to do bodies with intercepting orbits until we have them on rails. It looks very unrealistic and, to my mind, it'll be better to do asteroids with stable (resonances are good too) orbits.

Aren't ksp bodies on rail?

Yes, they are. But IRL when asteroid flies near the Earth, it will change it's orbit. KSP physics cannot do this now (until eggrobin's n-body mod is WIP), so it would be better not to do bodies on potentially unstable orbits.

I don't think it would break anything, unless the asteroid enters earth soi

I...really don't have anything to say except keep being awesome! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**UPDATE 2015/07/23**

***Added Ida's moon Dactyl ,the only known moon of an asteroidÃ¢â‚¬â€¹. Escape velocity is 0.9m/s....Yes your read right. Diameter of 1.4km.***

***Added (2) Pallas, the second largest asteroid in the solar system. It has a proper inclination of 33 degrees. Such an inclination made impossible for Dawn to make a flyby of this asteroid.***

***Added Pan, the closest moon of Saturn. It orbits inside Saturn's ring. (I had to cheat for this one. I changed a little bit its semi major axis so it orbits where it should)***

*Pics on page 1*
Added to planed features : Change Saturn's texture and maybe the rings texture too

Oh damn. Will fix that

Just popping in to say I see in your screenshots that some of the terrain can be a bit blocky. Good news is you can fix that by playing around with the PQS maxLevel parameter. Try adjusting it much lower to smooth out your terrain and get rid of any pixelation or blocky step-like terrain. Really small bodies should have maxLevel fairly low.

> 
> Just popping in to say I see in your screenshots that some of the terrain can be a bit blocky. Good news is you can fix that by playing around with the PQS maxLevel parameter. Try adjusting it much lower to smooth out your terrain and get rid of any pixelation or blocky step-like terrain. Really small bodies should have maxLevel fairly low.

Ahhh thank you , I was wondering what these parameters were for. I thought the pixelated ground was because of the small size of my bodies

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-25T15:00:13Z" title="07/25/2015 03:00  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 25, 2015</time> by pozine**
The blocky terrain was caused by a too small heightmap.
Tried a lot of different settings, without any conclusive results. The blocky looking pqs will stay this way until a fix is found. Sorry. :/
